description:
Music is the light that illuminates people's hearts-- and that "light" was suddenly taken from the world. The world changed the night the black "Kuroya Meteorite" fell. Grotesque monsters known as D2 emerged from the meteorite and began to overrun the land and people. As the D2 were drawn to melodies people played, eventually "music" itself became taboo.

However, those who opposed the monsters appeared. They the "Musicart," girls who draw power from music. They possess the great operas and musical scores of humanity history and use them to defeat the D2.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: แท็กต์ โอปัส. เดสตินี ~ลิขิตเสียง บรรเลงชะตา~

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Classical Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of classical, not to be applied to anime that use classical in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

node.description: **[Website](https://lam-illust.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ramdayo1122) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/17429)**

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/reiko_0157) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=reiko_nagasawa)

Reiko Nagasawa is an animator and character designer, raised and currently affiliated with Madhouse. She started her career in 2014 as an in-betweener for the studio. In 2021, she debuted as a character designer for [takt op.Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/131565/takt-opDestiny/).

Married to fellow animator [Tooru Iwasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/131949/Tooru-Iwasawa).

[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

ryo is the leader of [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell). He is the composer, arranger, and lyricist for all their songs.  In 2011 he created the fictional band [EGOIST](https://anilist.co/staff/114169) for the TV anime [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793).

__[Website](http://uni-mafumafu.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/uni-mafumafu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/uni_mafumafu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOTR1tcOAhjgi6YukrPpZxg) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/uni_mafumafu)__

__Introduction:__
Mafumafu, alternatively known as Kagami Mite Shisshin-P, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger, vocaloid producer, and audio engineer. He is better known as a utaite with a middle-high range voice.

__Biography:__
As a utaite he likes to add effects to his voice and scream loudly in his covers. He has a very wide vocal range and a versatile voice, having the ability to hit and leap into high notes effortlessly, sometimes to feminine range, without sounding strained or loosing the softness in his voice. However, he also sounds pleasant when he sings songs in his regular and lower voice, which can sound relaxing and quite soothing. On some of his covers, many people are often confused and argue about his gender when he utilizes his higher register, therefore making him a ryouserui. Because of his high vocal range, he is also capable of producing a very convincing female voice, most clearly seen in his cover of Matryoshka. He often makes use of his wide range in his covers by leaping into higher or lower octaves to match the tone of the song.

Occasionally he forgets some of the lyrics and either mumbles or makes cute noises until the next line. His songs are often tagged as someone with a "kakuseirui", also known as an energizing voice.

[Official Website](https://www.mikanakashima.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nakashima_mika_) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/nakashimamika/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mikanakashima_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mikanakashimaSMEJ)

She had always dreamed of becoming a singer since a child. She decided not to attend high school, and pursued her dream in a musical career.  

The very first demo tape she sent to a record company had given her the chance. She was chosen out of 3000 girls to be the heroine of the 2001 fall season drama “Kizudarake no Love Song (Scarred Love Song)” on Fuji TV. In November, she made her debut with Sony Music Associated Records, with the song “STARS," which was also the theme song of the drama. Her second single “CRESCENT MOON,” a groovy track with an 80’s flavor, was a limited product with only 100,000 copies. Amazingly, it sold out the first day of its release. In March 2002, she released her third single “ONE SURVIVE” and her first video “FILM LOTUS”; in May, her 4th single “HELPLESS RAIN”; in August, her 5th single “WILL."

In December 2006, Mika released “Hitoiro” for the NANA 2 movie under the name “NANA starring MIKA NAKASHIMA,” as well as a NANA album titled “THE END,” marking the conclusion of her association with NANA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/reiko_0157) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=reiko_nagasawa)

Reiko Nagasawa is an animator and character designer, raised and currently affiliated with Madhouse. She started her career in 2014 as an in-betweener for the studio. In 2021, she debuted as a character designer for [takt op.Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/131565/takt-opDestiny/).

Married to fellow animator [Tooru Iwasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/131949/Tooru-Iwasawa).
**Toshiyuki Kanno** is a Japanese character designer, animator, animation supervisor and animation director, affiliated with Studio Live.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/94072097)

Close friends with [Kai Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/132094/).

Married to fellow Animator [Reiko Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/140343).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shina4_7)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1189754972) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/bushi2424.bsky.social) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2415493) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takeshi_maenami)

He has gathered a lot of attention with his incredibly dynamic, [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-inspired cuts in [Pokémon Sun & Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/97634/). His animation is characterized by erratic snappy timing, liberal and ample use of smears (often with a complete lack of outlines), and extreme perspectives. 

Graduated Yoyogi Animation School in 2009, but spent much of the following years helping out at his parents' restaurant and didn't start formally working as an animator until 2018. Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).
__Hideki Ono__ is a Japanese CG animator.
She is currently working at MADBOX.
